qas.question: Who first observed the photoelectric effect?
When was the photoelectric effect first observed?
Who published the first thorough investigation of the photoelectric effect?
Who received the Nobel Prize in 1921 for his work on the photoelectric effect?
What did Einstein with the 1921 Nobel Prize for?

answers.text: his work on the photo-electric effect
the emission of electrons (called "photoelectrons") from a surface when light is shone on it

qas.question: Who first observed the photoelectric effect?
Einstein's paper on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in what year?
Einstein's photoelectric effect work was rewards as opposed to his work on what other topic?
Who last observed the photoelectric effect?
When was the photoelectric effect last observed?
Who published the first thorough investigation of the photosynthesis effect?

plausible_answers.text: his work on the photo-electric effect

qas.question: What did Einstein win the 1924 Nobel Prize for?

plausible_answers.text: the emission of electrons (called "photoelectrons") from a surface when light is shone on it

context: The photoelectric effect is <a5_0><b13_0>the emission of electrons (called "photoelectrons") from a surface when light is shone on it<b13_0/><a5_0/>. It was first observed by <a0_0><a6_0><b9_0>Alexandre Edmond Becquerel<b9_0/><a6_0/><a0_0/> in <a1_0><b10_0>1839<b10_0/><a1_0/>, although credit is usually reserved for <a2_0><b11_0>Heinrich Hertz<b11_0/><a2_0/>, who published the first thorough investigation in 1887. Another particularly thorough investigation was published by Philipp Lenard in 1902. <a3_0>Einstein<a3_0/>'s 1905 paper discussing the effect in terms of light quanta would earn him the Nobel Prize in <a7_0>1921<a7_0/>, when his predictions had been confirmed by the experimental work of Robert Andrews Millikan. The Nobel committee awarded the prize for <a4_0><b12_0>his work on the photo-electric effect<b12_0/><a4_0/>, rather than relativity, both because of a bias against purely theoretical physics not grounded in discovery or experiment, and dissent amongst its members as to the actual proof that <a8_0>relativity<a8_0/> was real.
